intro: Leucocraspedum albicaule, commonly known as the white-stemmed whitebark, is a member of the Betulaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its smooth, white bark and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, winged seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in temperate regions. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
